author: Staff Reporter
text:
Protest by members of Tamil Nadu Government Employees’ Association (TNGEA) and other associations continued for the 10th day in Madurai district with around 500 employees camping inside the Collector’s office on Friday as well.

Representatives from associations kept the protesting members engaged with songs, poems and talk on their continuing struggle and demands.

Some of the associations that took part in the protest were TN Revenue Officers’ Association (TNROA), TN Rural Development Officers’ Association (TNRDOA), TN Primary School Teachers’ Federation (TNPTF), TN Post Graduate Teachers’ Association (TNPGTA), TN Noon Meal Employees’ Association and TN Highways Department Road Workers’ Association.

TNROA office-bearers said that at least 300 employees from the association took part in the strike on Friday. Public who had come to the Collector’s office for obtaining certificates through e-service centres, revenue documents and for old age pension related queries faced difficulties. However, revenue offices in other parts of the district functioned smoothly.

Patients who had to undergo tests at Government Rajaji Hospital faced minor delays with a considerable number of lab technicians taking part in the strike. Members of TN Government Lab Technicians’ Association said that around 40 of about 80 lab technicians at the hospital boycotted work.

Hospital authorities, however, said that they had made alternative arrangements by deploying trainees to assist the lab technicians. TN Government All Pharmacists’ Association said that 40 pharmacists associated with GRH and other hospitals in the district took part in the strike on Friday.
title: TNGEA protest continues
